question.text: The Bond dissociation energy of <math> <mrow> <mtext>B</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow> </math> in <math> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>BF</mtext></mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> </msub> </mrow> </math> is <math> <mrow> <mtext>646</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kJ</mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup> <mrow> <mtext>mol</mtext></mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math> whereas that of <math> <mrow> <mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow> </math> in <math> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CF</mtext></mrow> <mtext>4</mtext> </msub> </mrow> </math> is <math> <mrow> <mtext>515</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kJ</mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup> <mrow> <mtext>mol</mtext></mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math>. The correct reason for higher <math> <mrow> <mtext>B</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow> </math> bond dissociation energy as compared to that of <math> <mrow> <mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow> </math> is

options.text: Smaller size of B atom as compared to that of C atom
Stronger <math> <mrow> <mi>σ</mi></mrow> </math> bond between B and F in BF<sub>3</sub> as Compared to that between C and F in CF<sub>4</sub>
Lower degree of <math> <mrow>  <mtext>pπ-pπ</mtext></mrow></math> interaction between B and F in BF<sub>3</sub>  than that between C and F in CF<sub>4</sub>

Significant <math> <mrow> <mtext>pπ-pπ</mtext></mrow> </math> interaction between B and F in BF<sub>3</sub><sub> </sub>  whereas there is no possibility of such interaction between C and F in CF<sub>4</sub>

solution.text: In <math> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>BF</mtext></mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> </msub> <mtext>,</mtext></mrow> </math>, <math> <mtext>B</mtext> </math> is <math> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>sp</mtext></mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msup> </mrow> </math> hybridised and has a vacant <math> <mrow> <mtext>2p</mtext></mrow> </math>-orbital which overlaps laterally with a filled <math> <mrow> <mtext>2p</mtext></mrow> </math>-orbital of <math> <mtext>F</mtext> </math> forming strong <math> <mrow> <mtext>pπ-pπ</mtext></mrow> </math> bond. However in <math> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CF</mtext></mrow> <mtext>4</mtext> </msub> <mtext>,</mtext></mrow> </math> <math> <mtext>C</mtext> </math> does not have any vacant <math> <mtext>p</mtext> </math>-orbitals to undergo <math> <mtext>p</mtext> </math>-bonding. Thus <math> <mrow>  <msub>   <mrow>    <mtext>BE</mtext></mrow>   <mrow>    <mtext>B</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow>  </msub>  <mtext> </mtext><mtext>></mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub>   <mrow>    <mtext>BE</mtext></mrow>   <mrow>    <mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow>  </msub>  </mrow></math>.
